title: Is there a comments section enabled on a blog? Is it beneficial? - Quora

response.answer_text: That depends on the site. Comments can be highly valuable as they encourage conversation with your reader. That provides relationship opportunities as well as increased chances to close a sale. Many blogs stopped allowing comments to weed out the spam. Personally, I set my comments to moderation required to allow me to choose if the are legit or spam am for editing prior to weed out links and such I do not approve. I also suspect there is a SERPs correlation to comments. The comments, the more valuable and interactive the content and it stands to reason Google is more likely to show it in search results pages, To further combat the majority of spam I use Cleantalk and find it 99% effective. It’s rare when I see a real spam comment. As a reader, I love commenting. I interact as I would on social sites building reciprocal relationships, guest blogging and link opportunities, and creating authority. Comments also create nofollow backlinks offering referral traffic and an indirect ranking signal.

I wouldn’t be without it: in 2001 I actually went to the trouble of integrating a comment system into a hand-coded (in WordPad!) blog. In the 11 years of my WordPress operation, I’ve garnered 58,000 comments, and I’d hate the idea of shutting those people down.
I think is beneficial. In this way readers will be able to express their feeling, help you to correct any mistake and with these comments you will be improving your blog.

Yes comments are important because it contributes to your Domain Authority, which should be above 20 alongside the Page Authority. This contributes toward a better Google SEO Score, and ultimately ranking capability. You can easily reach a Google Rating Above 80% In 6 Easy Steps when the average SEO Score on the majority of sites hover in the 50% bracket. You need to be above 75% in order for your site to be considered a Grade A Blog or Website.
A comments section on your blog is a way to start a conversation with potential leads and customers for your business, if you’re running a business blog.
